From Wiktionary, the free dictionary

Asturian

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

From Latin imitō.

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): /imiˈtaɾ/ [i.miˈt̪aɾ]
  • Rhymes: -aɾ
  • Syllabification: i‧mi‧tar

Verb

[edit]

imitar (first-person singular indicative present imito, past participle imitáu)

  1. imitate (to follow as a model)

Conjugation

[edit]
Conjugation of imitar
infinitive imitar
gerund imitando
past participle m imitáu, f imitada, n imitao, m pl imitaos, f pl imitaes
person first singular
yo 		second singular
tu 		third singular
él/elli 		first plural
nosotros/nós 		second plural
vosotros/vós 		third plural
ellos
indicative present imito imites imita imitamos imitáis imiten
imperfect imitaba imitabes imitaba imitábemos, imitábamos imitabeis, imitabais imitaben
preterite imité imitasti, imitesti imitó imitemos imitastis, imitestis imitaron
pluperfect imitare, imitara imitares, imitaras imitare, imitara imitáremos, imitáramos imitareis, imitarais imitaren, imitaran
future imitaré imitarás imitará imitaremos imitaréis imitarán
conditional imitaría imitaríes imitaría imitaríemos, imitaríamos imitaríeis, imitaríais imitaríen
subjunctive present imite imites, imitas imite imitemos imitéis imiten, imitan
imperfect imitare, imitara imitares, imitaras imitare, imitara imitáremos, imitáramos imitareis, imitarais imitaren, imitaran
imperative — imita — — imitái —

Related terms

[edit]
  • imitación

Further reading

[edit]
  • “imitar”, in Diccionariu de la llingua asturiana [Dictionary of the Asturian Language] (in Asturian), 1ª edición, Academia de la Llingua Asturiana, 2000, →ISBN
  • Xosé Lluis García Arias (2002–2004), “imitar”, in Diccionario general de la lengua asturiana [General Dictionary of the Asturian Language] (in Spanish), Editorial Prensa Asturiana, →ISBN

Catalan

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

Borrowed from Latin imitāre.

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): (Central, Balearic) [i.miˈta]
  • IPA(key): (Valencia) [i.miˈtaɾ]
  • Audio (Barcelona):(file)
  • Rhymes: -a(ɾ)
  • Hyphenation: i‧mi‧tar
  • Homophone: imità (except Valencian)

Verb

[edit]

imitar (first-person singular present imito, first-person singular preterite imití, past participle imitat)

  1. to imitate

Conjugation

[edit]
    Conjugation of imitar (first conjugation)
infinitive imitar
gerund imitant
past participle masculine feminine
singular imitat imitada
plural imitats imitades
person singular plural
first second third first second third
indicative jo tu ell/ella
vostè 		nosaltres
nós 		vosaltres
vós 		ells/elles
vostès
present imito imites imita imitem imiteu imiten
imperfect imitava imitaves imitava imitàvem imitàveu imitaven
future imitaré imitaràs imitarà imitarem imitareu imitaran
preterite imití imitares imità imitàrem imitàreu imitaren
conditional imitaria imitaries imitaria imitaríem imitaríeu imitarien
subjunctive jo tu ell/ella
vostè 		nosaltres
nós 		vosaltres
vós 		ells/elles
vostès
present imiti imitis imiti imitem imiteu imitin
imperfect imités imitessis imités imitéssim imitéssiu imitessin
imperative — tu vostè nosaltres vosaltres
vós 		vostès
affirmative — imita imiti imitem imiteu imitin
negative (no) — no imitis no imiti no imitem no imiteu no imitin

Related terms

[edit]
  • imitació
  • imitatiu

Further reading

[edit]
  • “imitar”, in Diccionari de la llengua catalana [Dictionary of the Catalan Language] (in Catalan), second edition, Institute of Catalan Studies [Catalan: Institut d'Estudis Catalans], April 2007
  • “imitar”, in Gran Diccionari de la Llengua Catalana, Grup Enciclopèdia Catalana, 2025
  • “imitar” in Diccionari normatiu valencià, Acadèmia Valenciana de la Llengua.
  • “imitar” in Diccionari català-valencià-balear, Antoni Maria Alcover and Francesc de Borja Moll, 1962.

Galician

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

Learned borrowing from Latin imitāre (“to copy, mimic”).

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): /imiˈtaɾ/ [i.miˈt̪aɾ]
  • Rhymes: -aɾ
  • Hyphenation: i‧mi‧tar

Verb

[edit]

imitar (first-person singular present imito, first-person singular preterite imitei, past participle imitado)

  1. (transitive) to imitate
  2. (intransitive) to resemble, to look like someone
  3. (pronominal) to resemble, to look like someone
    Imítase moito ao seu pai
    He looks a lot like his father

Conjugation

[edit]
    Conjugation of imitar
Singular Plural
First-person
(eu) 		Second-person
(ti) 		Third-person
(el / ela / Vde.) 		First-person
(nós) 		Second-person
(vós) 		Third-person
(eles / elas / Vdes.)

1Less recommended.

Related terms

[edit]
  • imitación
  • imitador

Further reading

[edit]
  • “imitar”, in Dicionario da Real Academia Galega (in Galician), A Coruña: Royal Galician Academy, 2012–2025
  • “imitar”, in Dicionário Estraviz de galego (in Galician), 2014–2025
  • Antón Luís Santamarina Fernández, editor (2006–2013), “imitar”, in Dicionario de Dicionarios da lingua galega [Dictionary of Dictionaries of the Galician language] (in Galician), Santiago de Compostela: Instituto da Lingua Galega
  • Antón Luís Santamarina Fernández, Ernesto Xosé González Seoane, María Álvarez de la Granja, editors (2003–2018), “imitar”, in Tesouro informatizado da lingua galega (in Galician), Santiago de Compostela: Instituto da Lingua Galega
  • Rosario Álvarez Blanco, editor (2014–2024), “imitar”, in Tesouro do léxico patrimonial galego e portugués (in Galician), Santiago de Compostela: Instituto da Lingua Galega, →ISSN

Ido

[edit]

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): /imiˈtar/

Verb

[edit]

imitar (present tense imitas, past tense imitis, future tense imitos, imperative imitez, conditional imitus)

  1. to imitate

Conjugation

[edit]

present past future
infinitive imitar imitir imitor
tense imitas imitis imitos
conditional imitus — —
imperative imitez — —

adverbial active participle imitante imitinte imitonte
nominal
active participle 		singular imitanto imitinto imitonto
plural imitanti imitinti imitonti
adjective passive participle imitata imitita imitota
adverbial passive participle imitate imitite imitote
nominal
passive participle 		singular imitato imitito imitoto
plural imitati imititi imitoti

imitar

  1. to imitate

Maltese

[edit]

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): /ɪ.mɪˈtaːr/
  • Rhymes: -aːr

Noun

[edit]

imitar m

  1. verbal noun of imita

Portuguese

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

Borrowed from Latin imitārī.

Pronunciation

[edit]
 
  • (Brazil) IPA(key): /i.miˈta(ʁ)/ [i.miˈta(h)]
  • (Brazil) IPA(key): /i.miˈta(ʁ)/ [i.miˈta(h)]
    • (São Paulo) IPA(key): /i.miˈta(ɾ)/
    • (Rio de Janeiro) IPA(key): /i.miˈta(ʁ)/ [i.miˈta(χ)]
    • (Southern Brazil) IPA(key): /i.miˈta(ɻ)/
 
  • (Portugal) IPA(key): /i.miˈtaɾ/
  • (Portugal) IPA(key): /i.miˈtaɾ/
    • (Southern Portugal) IPA(key): /i.miˈta.ɾi/

  • Hyphenation: i‧mi‧tar

Verb

[edit]

imitar (first-person singular present imito, first-person singular preterite imitei, past participle imitado)

  1. to imitate, mimic

Conjugation

[edit]
    Conjugation of imitar (See Appendix:Portuguese verbs)
Singular Plural
First-person
(eu) 		Second-person
(tu) 		Third-person
(ele / ela / você) 		First-person
(nós) 		Second-person
(vós) 		Third-person
(eles / elas / vocês)
Infinitive
Impersonal imitar
Personal imitar imitares imitar imitarmos imitardes imitarem
Gerund
imitando
Past participle
Masculine imitado imitados
Feminine imitada imitadas
Indicative
Present imito imitas imita imitamos imitais imitam
Imperfect imitava imitavas imitava imitávamos imitáveis imitavam
Preterite imitei imitaste imitou imitamos1, imitámos2 imitastes imitaram
Pluperfect imitara imitaras imitara imitáramos imitáreis imitaram
Future imitarei imitarás imitará imitaremos imitareis imitarão
Conditional imitaria imitarias imitaria imitaríamos imitaríeis imitariam
Subjunctive
Present imite imites imite imitemos imiteis imitem
Imperfect imitasse imitasses imitasse imitássemos imitásseis imitassem
Future imitar imitares imitar imitarmos imitardes imitarem
Imperative
Affirmative imita imite imitemos imitai imitem
Negative (não) não imites não imite não imitemos não imiteis não imitem

1Brazilian Portuguese.
2European Portuguese.

Related terms

[edit]
  • imitação
  • imitador

Further reading

[edit]
  • “imitar”, in Dicionário Aulete Digital (in Portuguese), Rio de Janeiro: Lexikon Editora Digital, 2008–2025
  • “imitar”, in Dicionário inFormal (in Portuguese), 2006–2025
  • “imitar” in Dicionário Aberto based on Novo Diccionário da Língua Portuguesa de Cândido de Figueiredo, 1913
  • “imitar”, in Dicionário infopédia da Lingua Portuguesa (in Portuguese), Porto: Porto Editora, 2003–2025
  • “imitar”, in Michaelis Dicionário Brasileiro da Língua Portuguesa (in Portuguese), São Paulo: Editora Melhoramentos, 2015–2025
  • “imitar”, in Dicionário Priberam da Língua Portuguesa (in Portuguese), Lisbon: Priberam, 2008–2025

Spanish

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

From Latin imitārī. Cognate with English imitate.

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): /imiˈtaɾ/ [i.miˈt̪aɾ]
  • Rhymes: -aɾ
  • Syllabification: i‧mi‧tar

Verb

[edit]

imitar (first-person singular present imito, first-person singular preterite imité, past participle imitado)

  1. to imitate, to mimic, to ape, to copy, to copycat, to impersonate, to simulate

Conjugation

[edit]
    Conjugation of imitar (See Appendix:Spanish verbs)
infinitive imitar
gerund imitando
past participle masculine feminine
singular imitado imitada
plural imitados imitadas
singular plural

imperative — tú
vos 		usted nosotros

affirmative imitatú
imitávos 		imite imitemos imitad imiten
negative no imites no imite no imitemos no imitéis no imiten

1Mostly obsolete, now mainly used in legal language.
2Argentine and Uruguayan voseo prefers the tú form for the present subjunctive.

    Selected combined forms of imitar

These forms are generated automatically and may not actually be used. Pronoun usage varies by region.
